metadata.feature_description: View and track which content items (pages, files) are using specific workflows.

steps.actual: Workflows list displayed showing Direct Publish, Save Draft, Content Approval, Test Workflow, and other workflows

steps.action: Click on Direct Publish workflow to expand it
steps.expected: Workflow details should expand with View Usage link visible
steps.actual: Workflow expanded showing 'This workflow is currently in use' message and 'View Usage' link

steps.expected: Workflow Usage Information panel should display with resource list
steps.actual: Workflow Usage Information panel displayed showing 20 resources including 8 Evoq Publisher Posts and 12 Folders

steps.action: View resources in Workflow Usage panel
steps.expected: If more than page size resources exist, pagination controls should be visible
steps.actual: All 20 resources displayed in a single scrollable list without pagination controls. The UI loads all resources at once for this dataset size.

steps.action: Count resources displayed in View Usage panel for Direct Publish workflow
steps.expected: Resource count should accurately reflect items using the workflow
steps.actual: 20 resources displayed: 8 Evoq Publisher Posts and 12 Folder items. Each item shows NAME and CONTENT TYPE columns with accurate data.

steps.action: Review CONTENT TYPE column in Workflow Usage panel
steps.expected: Different resource types should be clearly indicated
steps.actual: Two content types displayed: 'Evoq Publisher Post' for blog posts and 'Folder' for folder items. Content types are clearly labeled in the CONTENT TYPE column.

steps.action: Review NAME column in Workflow Usage panel
steps.expected: Resource titles should be meaningful and correctly display content names
steps.actual: Resource titles correctly displayed: Posts show descriptive titles like 'First Test Post About Technology', 'Tech News and Innovation', 'Test Post for Author Management'. Folders show paths like '/Badges/', '/Groups/', '/Images/Publisher/'

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test empty resource list for unused workflow

steps.action: Click View Usage for NewWorkflow (a workflow with no resources)
steps.expected: Empty resource list should be displayed with appropriate headers
steps.actual: Workflow Usage Information panel displayed for NewWorkflow showing 'You are viewing usage for the NewWorkflow workflow' with NAME and CONTENT TYPE column headers but no items listed - empty list correctly shown

observations: Workflows that are 'in use' display an info message 'This workflow is currently in use' with a 'View Usage' link
Workflows not in use (like Test Workflow, Test & <> Special Chars!) do NOT show the 'in use' message or 'View Usage' link
The IN USE column in the workflows list shows a checkmark for workflows that have resources assigned
The resource list displays all items at once in a scrollable container rather than using pagination - this works well for moderate dataset sizes
Code repository was empty so code review was not possible, but UI testing was comprehensive
